name: NPR
text:
Women are often written off in rap and made invisible in the prison system. One Philly rapper is pushing back.
 
@LouderThanARiot's new episode tells the story of Isis Tha Saviour and how she is using hip-hop to transform trauma into freedom. https://t.co/x8TH4qYJWe https://t.co/SKNMPLxmCZ

name: NPR
text: 30 years after his death, Roald Dahl's family has apologized for the author's anti-Semitism. https://t.co/KF8UDBPnYP

name: NPR
text: More than 100,000 customers in Maine and 16,000 in New Hampshire are without power as of Sunday evening. https://t.co/Ftu8Y391QB

name: NPR
text: California Attorney General Xavier Becerra has been selected to serve as secretary of Health and Human Services in the Biden administration. https://t.co/3mSq6kB8l2

name: NPR
text:
Migraines, dizziness, memory loss and other ailments that dozens of U.S. diplomats have complained of while serving in Cuba and China “are consistent with the effects of directed, pulsed, radiofrequency energy,” a new report finds.
https://t.co/eaT8M4k7gi

name: NPR
text:
"These children are growing up in neighborhoods that rob them of opportunity and a childhood," says photojournalist Danielle Villasana. 

"But they are still having moments of playfulness and doing things that kids do everywhere."
https://t.co/Pl2mfB6Bw7

name: NPR
text: When Jeff Gerson woke up from his treatment, he had no memory of being intubated. So he set out to thank the more than 116 hospital workers who cared for him when he was sick with COVID-19. @hereandnow https://t.co/8RJmcm1OwI

name: NPR
text:
Kaavan has been alone ever since his mate at a decrepit Islamabad zoo died in 2012. Last week, Dr. Amir Khalil helped move him to Cambodia to be with other elephants. His secret to calming Kavaan?

"He loves Frank Sinatra music: 'My Way.' " 

So, he sang. https://t.co/UHNsykIyYi
